info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 8:47PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW ACROSS NORTHERN ERIE AND FAR SOUTHERN NIAGARA COUNTIES WILL DRIFT SLOWLY SOUTH THROUGH LATE THIS EVENING... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 843 PM EST, a band of heavy snow was over northern Erie County including Tonawanda and Amherst. The band will begin to move slowly southward through 10 p.m. During this time the band will move across downtown Buffalo, reaching the Buffalo Southtowns around or shortly after 10 p.m. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Williamsville, Grand Island, Akron, Small Boat Harbor, Erie Basin Marina, Alden, Clarence Center, East Amherst, Wolcottsville and Rapids. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 54. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
